intro: Cupania livida, commonly known as the silvercup plant, is a flowering plant species native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and produces small, pale yellow flowers. Cupania livida is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
